location: Springdale, Utah; St. George, Utah, USA
summary: Tech-savvy Performing Arts Director with 25+ years of experience in event management, programming, marketing, and venue operations across multiple venues. Proven track record of increasing profitability, funding endowments, and reimagining venues; strong leadership and relationship-building abilities.

experience.title: Director of Programming Arts
experience.description: Oversees cultural arts activities across multiple venues (Cox Performing Arts Center and Tanner Amphitheater); manages programming, marketing, hospitality, financial accounts, administration, and fulfillment; guides the CCS Board of Directors; developed and managed summer programming at the Tanner Amphitheater; redesigned venue operations, added concessions, permits for alcohol service, and implemented two series formats including Sanctuary: The Story of Zion.

experience.title: Board Member
experience.description: Serves on the SUSWA Board; plans and implements clinics for members; creates and manages multiple concert series in Southern Utah (St George area).

experience.title: Operations Manager/Owner
experience.description: Managed daily operations of a busy commercial recording studio; produced production music featured on networks such as Discovery, Disney, and A&E; hired and led engineers and musicians; provided A/V equipment for festival-style shows; built industry relationships; later transitioned day-to-day operations to a studio manager while continuing ownership.

experience.title: Musician
experience.description: Touring/performing musician with global travel; foundational perspective for career in performing arts management; deep understanding of touring challenges, technical demands, and marketing/management.
